Name: Requiring the Department of Buildings to refer possible false filings to the District Attorney.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Buildings to refer possible false filings to the District Attorney.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Article 103 of chapter 1 of title 28 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 28-103.18.2 to read as follows:
28-103.18.2.  Referral of false filings to the District Attorney.  For each case in which investigation of a complaint reveals the possibility that a false instrument has been filed, the records of the complaint must be forwarded to the office of the District Attorney having jurisdiction over the case.
	Â§2. This local law shall take effect 120 days after its enactment into law.
